snippet: Even after the building collapse, it’s unclear whether the government will carry out labor reforms.
abstract: Editorial expresses skepticism about Bangladeshi government's willingness to follow through on its pledge to reform its labor laws and safety standards in wake of collapse of factory building that killed more than 1,000 people; calls on Western companies to actively press factory owners to honor right of workers to negotiate for better conditions.
lead_paragraph: Even after the building collapse, it’s unclear whether the government will carry out labor reforms.

headline.seo: More Promises About Labor Reform in Bangladesh
headline.main: Another Round of Promises in Bangladesh
headline.print_headline: Another Round of Promises in Bangladesh
